snippet: Some recipients of aid under the Clinton-era Temporary Assistance for Needy Families program have taken desperate measures to make ends meet.
abstract: Clinton-era law intended to revamp the welfare system won bipartisan praise for reducing caseloads and bolstering employment, but it has resulted in a series of dire consequences for poor families since the beginning of the recession; 16 states, facing budgetary crises, have used the law to further cut their caseloads, forcing families to resort to desperate and often illegal measures to survive.
lead_paragraph: Some recipients of aid under the Clinton-era Temporary Assistance for Needy Families program have taken desperate measures to make ends meet.

headline.seo: Welfare Limits Left Poor Adrift as Recession Hit
headline.main: Welfare Limits Left Poor Adrift as Recession Hit
headline.print_headline: Welfare Limits Left Poor Adrift as Recession Hit
